prompt: Build a simple task management app. I should be able to create, view, update, and delete tasks. Each task should have a title and a description. Keep the UI very basic.

intent.app_summary: A simple task management application with basic CRUD capabilities for tasks.

Task.description: A task with a title and a description

assumptions: Local execution
Single-user application
The application is intended for a single user without authentication.
Tasks are stored locally (e.g., in a local database or file).
The UI will not include advanced features such as drag‑and‑drop, filtering, or sorting beyond a basic list view.
non_goals: No advanced UI interactions (e.g., drag‑and‑drop, calendar integration).

change_summary: Defined the Task entity, CRUD operations, basic form and list UI, and explicit assumptions and non‑goals based on the user description.

prompt: I want a small app to track things I need to do daily.

intent.app_summary: A small task tracking app for daily to‑do items

Task.description: A task with a title and optional details

assumptions: Local execution
Single-user application
Each task is intended to be completed on the current day, so a date or due‑date field may be relevant but is not explicitly specified
The user will view a list of tasks and add new ones via a form

change_summary: Created a minimal Task entity with required title field, standard CRUD operations, form_and_list UI, and assumptions about daily scheduling.

prompt: Create an expense tracking app. Each expense should have an amount, category, date, and optional notes. I only need this for myself, no login or multi-user support.

intent.app_summary: An expense tracking app that allows a single user to create, view, update, and delete expense entries. Each expense contains an amount, category, date, and optional notes.

Expense.description: A record of a single expenditure with monetary value, classification, timestamp, and optional textual details

assumptions: Local execution
Single-user application
The application is intended for a single user with no authentication or multi‑user support.
Data can be stored locally (e.g., in a file or embedded database).

change_summary: Initial creation of intent specification for a single‑user expense tracker.

prompt: Build a lightweight bug tracker for my personal projects. Each bug should have a title, severity, status, and description. I want to see all open bugs first.

intent.app_summary: A lightweight bug tracker for personal projects that lists bugs with a priority to show open bugs first.

Bug.description: A report of an issue found in a personal project, identified by a title and detailed by severity, status, and description.

assumptions: Local execution
Single-user application
Open bugs are shown before closed bugs in the UI.
The application is intended for single-user, personal use.
The status field values will indicate whether a bug is open or closed.

change_summary: Defined a single Bug entity with required fields, CRUD operations, standard form-and-list UI, and captured user preference for ordering open bugs first.

prompt: Build a notes app where I can create, edit, and delete notes. Each note should have a title and content.

intent.app_summary: Build a notes app where I can create, edit, and delete notes. Each note should have a title and content.

Note.description: A note with a title and content

assumptions: Local execution
Single-user application

change_summary: No changes to the intent after initial definition.

prompt: Build a backend-only API for managing tasks. I don't need any UI. I just want REST endpoints to create, update, list, and delete tasks.

intent.app_summary: REST API for task management with CRUD endpoints.
assumptions: Local execution
Single-user application
No front‑end UI is required; only REST endpoints will be exposed.

change_summary: Defined minimal Task entity, CRUD operations, backend‑only UI expectation, and clarified non‑goals.

prompt: Build a read-only dashboard that shows expenses by category. I don't want to create or edit data from the app — just view it.

intent.app_summary: A read‑only dashboard that visualises total expenses grouped by category.

Expense.description: A financial expense record belonging to a category, with an amount.

assumptions: Local execution
Single-user application
The application will only display existing expense data; no creation or editing is allowed.
Expense amounts are whole numbers (e.g., in cents) suitable for integer representation.
Data is already available in the system; the dashboard will aggregate totals per category for display.
non_goals: Editing or deleting existing expense entries.
Providing any form or input controls for data manipulation.

change_summary: Created a minimal intent spec for a read‑only expense dashboard.

prompt: Build a simple UI that lets me manually enter and view notes in the browser. I don't need any backend or APIs — the data can live only in the UI for now.

intent.app_summary: A simple browser UI for creating and viewing notes without any backend or persistence.

Note.description: A note with a title and content

assumptions: Local execution
Single-user application
The note data is stored only in UI memory and does not persist across page reloads.
The application is single-user and does not require authentication.
